DataElement.preferredDefinition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body._The stage of tumor when it spreads to the lymph node

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest.

Concepts.longName: Regional Lymph Node
Concepts.definition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest.

Property.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm Stage
Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9/28/10 Released for use in caTissue Suite version 1.1 and/or 1.2 per owners direction.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The stage of tumor when it spreads to the lymph node

PermissibleValues.value: pN1 - Metastasis in a single regional lymph node

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with metastasis to a single regional lymph node. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with metastasis to a single regional lymph node. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN0 - No regional lymph node metastasis

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pNX - Cannot be assessed

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pNX TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN0 - No regional lymph node metastasis histologically (none greater than 0.2mm) with no examination for isolated tumor cells

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer without histological evidence of regional lymph node involvement (no isolated tumor cell cluster greater than 0.2mm), and in which no examination for isolated tumor cells is performed. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer without histological evidence of regional lymph node involvement (no isolated tumor cell cluster greater than 0.2mm), and in which no examination for isolated tumor cells is performed. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: Not specified

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

Concepts.longName: Unspecified
Concepts.definition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

PermissibleValues.value: pN0(i+) - No regional lymph node metastasis histologically with positive morphologic findings for ITC's and no ITC cluster greater than 0.2mm

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer without histological evidence of regional lymph node involvement, and positive morphologic findings for isolated tumor cells (ITCs) using any morphologic technique (including hematoxylin-eosin and/or immunohistochemistry), and no ITC cluster greater than 0.2 mm. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN0(i+) TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer without histological evidence of regional lymph node involvement, and positive morphologic findings for isolated tumor cells (ITCs) using any morphologic technique (including hematoxylin-eosin and/or immunohistochemistry), and no ITC cluster greater than 0.2 mm. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN0(i-) - No regional lymph node metastasis histologically with negative morphologic findings for ITC's

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer without histological evidence of regional lymph node involvement, and negative morphologic findings for isolated tumor cells using any morphologic technique (including hematoxylin-eosin and/or immunohistochemistry). (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN0(i-) TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer without histological evidence of regional lymph node involvement, and negative morphologic findings for isolated tumor cells using any morphologic technique (including hematoxylin-eosin and/or immunohistochemistry). (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pNX - Cannot be assessed - previously removed/not removed for pathologic study

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (e.g., previously removed, or not removed for pathologic study). (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pNX TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (e.g., previously removed, or not removed for pathologic study). (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN1 - Regional lymph node metastasis
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pN1 TNM Finding

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pN1 TNM Finding
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer with regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer with regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN1a - Metastasis in single regional lymph node
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pN1a TNM Finding

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pN1a TNM Finding
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer with metastasis to a single regional lymph node. (from CAP Cancer of the Endocrine Pancreas Protocol- January 2005 Revision)

Concepts.longName: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pN1a TNM Finding
Concepts.definition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer with metastasis to a single regional lymph node. (from CAP Cancer of the Endocrine Pancreas Protocol- January 2005 Revision)

PermissibleValues.value: pN1b - Metastasis in multiple regional lymph node
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pN1b TNM Finding

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pN1b TNM Finding
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer with metastasis to more than one regional lymph node. (from CAP Cancer of the Endocrine Pancreas Protocol- January 2005 Revision)

Concepts.longName: Exocrine Pancreatic Cancer pN1b TNM Finding
Concepts.definition: Exocrine pancreatic cancer with metastasis to more than one regional lymph node. (from CAP Cancer of the Endocrine Pancreas Protocol- January 2005 Revision)

PermissibleValues.value: pN1c - Metastasis in one to three axillary lymph nodes and internal mammary nodes with microscopic disease detected by sentinel lymph node dissection

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastasis in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes and in internal mammary nodes with microscopic disease detected by sentinel lymph node dissection but not clinically apparent. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN1c TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastasis in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes and in internal mammary nodes with microscopic disease detected by sentinel lymph node dissection but not clinically apparent. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN1b - Metastasis in internal mammary lymph nodes with microscopic disease detected by sentinel lymph node dissection

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastasis in internal mammary lymph nodes with microscopic disease detected by sentinel lymph node dissection but not clinically apparent. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN1b TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastasis in internal mammary lymph nodes with microscopic disease detected by sentinel lymph node dissection but not clinically apparent. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN1a - Metastasis in one to three axillary lymph nodes (atleast one tumor deposit greater than 2.0mm)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastasis in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (at least 1 tumor deposit greater than 2.0 mm). (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN1a TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastasis in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (at least 1 tumor deposit greater than 2.0 mm). (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN1mi - Micrometastasis (greater than 0.2mm but none greater than 2.0mm)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with micrometastasis (greater than 0.2 mm, none greater than 2.0 mm). (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN1mi TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with micrometastasis (greater than 0.2 mm, none greater than 2.0 mm). (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN1 - Metastasis in one to three axillary lymph nodes and/or internal mammary nodes with microscopic disease detected by sentinel lymph node dissection

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastasis to 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes, and/or internal mammary nodes with microscopic disease detected by sentinel lymph node dissection but not clinically apparent. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastasis to 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes, and/or internal mammary nodes with microscopic disease detected by sentinel lymph node dissection but not clinically apparent. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN0(mol+) - No regional lymph node metastasis histologically with positive nonmorphologic (molecular) findings for ITC's

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with positive molecular findings by RT-PCR, but without histological or immunohistochemical evidence of regional lymph node involvement. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN0(mol+) TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with positive molecular findings by RT-PCR, but without histological or immunohistochemical evidence of regional lymph node involvement.  (from AJCC 6th and 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN3 - Metastasis in contrlateral mediastinal/contralateral hilar/ ipsilateral or contralateral scalene/ supraclavicular lymph node(s)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with metastasis to contralateral mediastinal, contralateral hilar, ipsilateral or contralateral scalene, or supraclavicular lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with metastasis to contralateral mediastinal, contralateral hilar, ipsilateral or contralateral scalene, or supraclavicular lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN2 - Metastasis in ipsilateral mediastinal and/or subcarinal lymph node(s)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with metastasis to ipsilateral mediastinal and/or subcarinal lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with metastasis to ipsilateral mediastinal and/or subcarinal lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN1 - Metastasis in ipsilateral peribronchial and/or ipsilateral hilar lymph nodes including intrapulmonary nodes involved by direct extension of primary tumor

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lung cancer with metastasis to ipsilateral peribronchial and/or ipsilateral hilar lymph nodes, including intrapulmonary nodes involved by direct extension of the primary tumor. (from CAP Lung Cancer Protocol--January 2005 Revision)

Concepts.longName: Lung Cancer pN1 TNM Finding
Concepts.definition: Lung cancer with metastasis to ipsilateral peribronchial and/or ipsilateral hilar lymph nodes, including intrapulmonary nodes involved by direct extension of the primary tumor. (from CAP Lung Cancer Protocol--January 2005 Revision)

PermissibleValues.value: pN0(mol-) - No regional lymph node metastasis histologically with negative nonmorphologic (molecular) findings for ITC's

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer without histological evidence of regional lymph node involvement, and with negative molecular findings by RT-PCR. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN0(mol-) TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer without histological evidence of regional lymph node involvement, and with negative molecular findings by RT-PCR. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN1 - Metastasis in regional lymph node or nodes

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prostate cancer with involvement of regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Prostate Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Prostate cancer with metastases in regional node(s).  (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN2 - Metastasis in four or more lymph nodes

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis to 4 or more regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis in four or more regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN1 - Metastasis in one to three lymph nodes

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis to 1 to 3 regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Colorectal Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Colorectal cancer with metastasis in 1-3 regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN3 - Metastasis in 4 or more regional lymph nodes/matted metastatic nodes/in-transit metastasis/ satellite(s) with metastasis in regional nodes

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma involving four or more regional lymph nodes, or with a finding of matted metastatic nodes, or with in-transit metastasis or satellite(s) with metastasis in regional lymph node(s). (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN3 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma involving four or more regional lymph nodes, or with a finding of matted metastatic nodes, or with in-transit metastasis or satellite(s) with metastasis in regional lymph node(s). (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN2c - Satellite or in-transit metastasis without nodel metastasis

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma without involvement of regional lymph nodes, with satellite or in-transit metastasis. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2c TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma without involvement of regional lymph nodes, with satellite or in-transit metastasis. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN2b - Clinically apparent (macroscopic) metastasis

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with macroscopic, clinically apparent metastasis to two or three regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2b TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with macroscopic, clinically apparent metastasis to two or three regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN2a - Clinically occult (microscopic) metastasis

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with microscopic, clinically occult metastasis to two or three regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2a TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with microscopic, clinically occult metastasis to two or three regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN2 - Metastasis in two to three regional nodes or intra lymphatic-regional metastasis without nodal metastasis

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma involving two to three regional lymph nodes, or involving the regional intra-lymphatic system without nodal involvement. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma involving two to three regional lymph nodes, or involving the regional intra-lymphatic system without nodal involvement. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN1b - Clinically apparent (macroscopic) metastasis

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with macroscopic, clinically apparent metastasis to a single lymph node. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN1b TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with macroscopic, clinically apparent metastasis to a single lymph node. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN1a - Clinically occult (microscopic) metastasis

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with microscopic, clinically occult metastasis to a single lymph node. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN1a TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with microscopic, clinically occult metastasis to a single lymph node. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN3c - Metastasis in ipsilateral supraclavicular Lymph nodes

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastasis in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN3c TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastasis in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN3b - Metastasis in clinically apparent ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes in presence of one or more positive axillary lymph nodes or in more than three axillary lymph nodes and in internal mammary lymph nodes

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastasis in clinically apparent ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes in the presence of 1 or more positive axillary lymph nodes; or in more than 3 axillary lymph nodes and in internal mammary lymph nodes with microscopic disease detected by sentinel lymph node dissection but not clinically apparent. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN3b TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastasis in clinically apparent ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes in the presence of 1 or more positive axillary lymph nodes; or in more than 3 axillary lymph nodes and in internal mammary lymph nodes with microscopic disease detected by sentinel lymph node dissection but not clinically apparent. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN3a - Metastasis in ten or more axillary lymph nodes (atleast one tumor deposit greater than 2.0mm) or metastasis to infraclavicular lymph nodes

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastases in 10 or more axillary lymph nodes (at least one tumor deposit greater than 2.0 mm); or metastases to the infraclavicular (level III axillary) lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN3a TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastases in 10 or more axillary lymph nodes (at least one tumor deposit greater than 2.0 mm); or metastases to the infraclavicular (level III axillary) lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN2b - Metastasis in clinically apparent internal mammary lymph nodes in the absence of axillary lymph node metastases

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastasis in clinically apparent internal mammary lymph nodes in the absence of axillary lymph node metastases. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN2b TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastasis in clinically apparent internal mammary lymph nodes in the absence of axillary lymph node metastases. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN2a - Metastasis in four to nine axillary lymph nodes (atleast one tumor deposit greater than 2.0mm)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastasis in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes (at least 1 tumor deposit greater than 2.0 mm). (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN2a TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastasis in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes (at least 1 tumor deposit greater than 2.0 mm). (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.value: pN2 - Metastasis in more than one regional lymph node

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Kidney cancer with metastasis to more than one regional lymph node. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Kidney Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v6
Concepts.definition: Kidney cancer with metastasis to more than one regional lymph node. (from AJCC 6th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Body tissue, region, surface, cavity, fluid, organ, or collection of organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm Stage
Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
